title: Derivative of an integral with Chain rule

content.question: If \(f\) is the function given by <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>4</mn> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <msup> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qacaWGMbWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadIhaaiaawIcacaGLPaaacqGH9aqp daWdXaWdaeaapeWaaOaaa8aabaWdbiaadshapaWaaWbaaSqabeaape GaaGOmaaaakiabgkHiTiaadshaaSqabaaapaqaa8qacaaI0aaapaqa a8qacaaIYaGaamiEaaqdcqGHRiI8aOWdaiaaysW7peGaamizaiaads haaaa@4761@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>, then <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msup> <mi>f</mi> <mo>′</mo> </msup> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qaceWGMbGbauaadaqadaWdaeaapeGaaGOmaaGaayjkaiaawMcaaiab g2da9aaa@3A77@ </annotation> </semantics> </math>

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
